费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 作者：安德鲁·朗格

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Once upon a time there was a poor laborer who, feeling that he had not much longer to live, wished to divide his possessions between his son and daughter, whom he loved dearly.

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: So he called them to him, and said: “Your mother brought me as her dowry two stools and a straw bed; I have, besides, a hen, a pot of pinks, and a silver ring, which were given me by a noble lady who once lodged in my poor cottage.

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: As for your daughter, I promise you that she shall be more beautiful than anyone you ever saw in your life; call her Felicia, and when she grows up give her the ring and the pot of pinks to console her for her poverty.’
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 至于您的女儿，我向您保证，她会比您一生中见过的所有人都要美丽；叫她费利西娅吧，等她长大了，就把这枚戒指和这盆石竹花交给她，来抚慰她的贫困。’

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: I like order in my house.”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 我喜欢我屋里的东西整整齐齐的。”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “What are you doing here, my pretty child?” asked the Queen.

费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 她一直流浪，到这个小屋的时候，因为寒冷和疲惫她都快不行了。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: I was the laborer’s wife, and was a good nurse, and the Queen gave you into my charge, and told me all her misfortunes, and then died before she had time to say what was to become of you.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 我本是劳工的妻子，也是个称职的奶妈，王后就把你托付给我照料，并且把她所有不幸的遭遇都告诉了我，然后她还没来得及说你将来会变成什么样子，就去世了。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “As I never in all my life could keep a secret, I could not help telling this strange tale to my neighbors, and one day a beautiful lady came here, and I told it to her also.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “我这辈子连一个秘密都守不住，就忍不住向我的邻居讲了这个奇怪的故事。一天，一位美丽的女士来到这里，我把这个故事也告诉给了她。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: When I had finished she touched me with a wand she held in her hand, and instantly I became a hen, and there was an end of my talking!
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 当我讲完故事的时候，她用手上握的一根魔杖碰了我一下，我就立刻变成了一只母鸡，从那时起我就再也不能说话了！

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: I was very sad, and my husband, who was out when it happened, never knew what had become of me.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 我非常难过，而这一切发生的时候我丈夫还在外边，他也就永远没办法知道我出了什么事。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: After seeking me everywhere he believed that I must have been drowned, or eaten up by wild beasts in the forest.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 他到处找我都没找到，于是他觉得我肯定是淹死了，或者是被森林里的野兽给吞掉了。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: That same lady came here once more, and commanded that you should be called Felicia, and left the ring and the pot of pinks to be given to you; and while she was in the house twenty-five of the King’s guards came to search for you, doubtless meaning to kill you; but she muttered a few words, and immediately they all turned into cabbages.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 那个女士又来了一次，要求叫你费利西娅，然后专门为你留下了一枚戒指和一盆石竹花；她还在小屋里的时候，国王就派了二十五名守卫来搜寻你了，无疑是想杀了你；但她低声说了几个字，所有的守卫们就立刻变成了卷心菜。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: It was one of them whom you threw out of your window yesterday.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 昨天你扔出窗外的那棵卷心菜就是其中一个。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “I don’t know how it was that he could speak—I have never heard either of them say a word before, nor have I been able to do it myself until now.”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “我不知道它是如何能开口说话的——我之前从没听过它们中的任何一个说过一个字，我自己也是直到现在才能开口说话的。”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: The Princess was greatly astonished at the hen’s story, and said kindly: “I am truly sorry for you, my poor nurse, and wish it was in my power to restore you to your real form.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 对于老母鸡的故事，这位公主十分震惊，然后她和蔼地说：“我非常同情你，我可怜的奶妈，我真希望自己有能力把你变回原来的样子。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: But we must not despair; it seems to me, after what you have told me, that something must be going to happen soon.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 但我们一定不能绝望；在听完你给我讲的这一切后，我感觉马上就要会有一些事情发生了。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Just now, however, I must go and look for my pinks, which I love better than anything in the world.”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 然而，眼下我必须去找我的石竹花，因为我爱它们胜过爱世上的任何东西。”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Bruno had gone out into the forest, never thinking that Felicia would search in his room for the pinks, and she was delighted by his unexpected absence, and thought to get them back without further trouble.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 布鲁诺已经离开家进了森林，他从没想到费利西娅会在他的房间里找石竹花。他的突然外出让她很高兴，她想把那些花拿回来，同时不惹来更多的麻烦。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: But as soon as she entered the room she saw a terrible army of rats, who were guarding the straw bed; and when she attempted to approach it they sprang at her, biting and scratching furiously.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 但她一进房间，就看到一大群可怕的老鼠，它们正守卫着那张稻草床；当她试图向床靠近时，那些老鼠朝她跳去，凶悍地对她又咬又抓。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Quite terrified, she drew back, crying out: “Oh! my dear pinks, how can you stay here in such bad company?”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 她非常害怕，便退了回来，嘴里哭喊道：“啊！我亲爱的石竹花，这些伙伴这么糟糕，你们是怎么待下去的呀？”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Then she suddenly bethought herself of the pitcher of water, and, hoping that it might have some magic power, she ran to fetch it, and sprinkled a few drops over the fierce-looking swarm of rats.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 然后，她忽然想起了那罐水，她一边跑去拿水，一边期盼着那罐水或许有些魔力，接着她朝那一大群凶神恶煞的老鼠洒了几滴水。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: In a moment not a tail or a whisker was to be seen.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 一瞬间，就连老鼠的尾巴和胡须都看不见了。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Each one had made for his hole as fast as his legs could carry him, so that the Princess could safely take her pot of pinks.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 每只老鼠都竭尽全力尽快朝鼠洞逃去，这样公主就能安全地拿回她那罐石竹花了。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: She found them nearly dying for want of water, and hastily poured all that was left in the pitcher upon them.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 她发现那些花儿由于缺水都快枯死了，便赶快把水罐里面剩下的所有水都浇到了花上。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: As she bent over them, enjoying their delicious scent, a soft voice, that seemed to rustle among the leaves, said:
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 正当她朝它们俯下身去，享受它们芬芳的花香时，一个似乎在花叶之间窸窣作响的柔软声音发话了：

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “Lovely Felicia, the day has come at last when I may have the happiness of telling you how even the flowers love you and rejoice in your beauty.”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “可爱的费利西娅，这一天终于来了，我终于可以愉快地告诉你即使是花朵都有多么爱你，多么为你的美丽而欣喜。”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: The Princess, quite overcome by the strangeness of hearing a cabbage, a hen, and a pink speak, and by the terrible sight of an army of rats, suddenly became very pale, and fainted away.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 公主听到一棵卷心菜，一只母鸡和一朵石竹花对她说话，又看到一大群老鼠，她被这些奇怪的事和可怕的景象吓到了，突然面如土色，昏了过去。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: At this moment in came Bruno.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 就在这时，布鲁诺进来了。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Working hard in the heat had not improved his temper, and when he saw that Felicia had succeeded in finding her pinks he was so angry that he dragged her out into the garden and shut the door upon her.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 即使是在烈日下辛苦劳作也没能让他的脾气好一点儿，看到费利西娅成功找到了她的石竹花，他非常愤怒，把她拖到外面的花园，然后关上门不让她进来。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: The fresh air soon made her open her pretty eyes, and there before her stood the Queen of the Woods, looking as charming as ever.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 新鲜的空气很快使她睁开了美丽的双眸，森林女王就站在她面前，她看起来跟之前一样迷人。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “You have a bad brother,” she said; “I saw he turned you out.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “你哥哥很坏，”她说，“我看着他把你赶出来。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Shall I punish him for it?”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 我能因为这件事惩罚他吗？”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “Ah! no, madam,” she said; “I am not angry with him.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “啊！不，夫人，”她说，“我不生他的气。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “But supposing he was not your brother, after all, what would you say then?” asked the Queen.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “可是假使他不是你的哥哥，那你会怎么说？”女王问道。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “Oh! but I think he must be,” said Felicia.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “哦！但我想他肯定是我哥哥。”费利西娅说。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “What!” said the Queen, “have you not heard that you are a Princess?”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “什么！”女王说，“难道你没听说你是一位公主吗？”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “I was told so a little while ago, madam, but how could I believe it without a single proof?”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “前不久，有人是这么告诉我的，夫人，但一点儿证据都没有，我怎么能相信呢？”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “Ah! dear child,” said the Queen, “the way you speak assures me that, in spite of your humble upbringing, you are indeed a real princess, and I can save you from being treated in such a way again.”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “啊！亲爱的孩子，”女王说道，“你说话的方式使我确信，尽管长于粗鄙之家，但你确实是一位真正的公主。我可以搭救你，让你不再受此待遇。”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: She was interrupted at this moment by the arrival of a very handsome young man.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 这时，一位英俊青年的到来打断了她。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: He wore a coat of green velvet fastened with emerald clasps, and had a crown of pinks on his head.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 他穿着一件绿色天鹅绒大衣，上面系着翡翠扣子，他的头上戴着石竹花做的王冠。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: He knelt upon one knee and kissed the Queen’s hand.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 他单腿跪地，亲吻着女王的手。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “Ah!” she cried, “my pink, my dear son, what a happiness to see you restored to your natural shape by Felicia’s aid!”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “啊！”她喊道，“我的石竹花，我亲爱的儿子，看到你在费利西娅的帮助下恢复了本来面目，我真是无比高兴啊！”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: And she embraced him joyfully.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 然后她非常开心地拥抱他。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Then, turning to Felicia, she said:
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 接着，她转向费利西娅，说道：

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “Charming Princess, I know all the hen told you, but you cannot have heard that the zephyrs, to whom was entrusted the task of carrying my son to the tower where the Queen, your mother, so anxiously waited for him, left him instead in a garden of flowers, while they flew off to tell your mother.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “美丽的公主，我知道那只母鸡告诉你的一切，但你肯定还没听说过：西风之神被托付了一项任务，他负责把我儿子带到王后，也就是你母亲那里去。她在塔里焦急地等着他，但西风之神却把他留在一个花园里，自己飞去告知你的母亲。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Whereupon a fairy with whom I had quarrelled changed him into a pink, and I could do nothing to prevent it.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 于是，一个曾经与我有过争吵的仙女把他变成了一朵石竹花，而我却没办法阻止这件事发生。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “You can imagine how angry I was, and how I tried to find some means of undoing the mischief she had done; but there was no help for it.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “你能想象得出我有多愤怒，还有我做了多少努力，想找到方法解开她的咒语；但都于事无补。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: I could only bring Prince Pink to the place where you were being brought up, hoping that when you grew up he might love you, and by your care be restored to his natural form.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 我只能把石竹花王子带到你成长的地方，希望当你长大成人的时候，他会爱上你，并且在你的照料下，能变回原来的样子。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: And you see everything has come right, as I hoped it would.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 而你已经看到了，所有的一切都回归正轨，正如我希望的那样。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Your giving me the silver ring was the sign that the power of the charm was nearly over, and my enemy’s last chance was to frighten you with her army of rats.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 你把银戒指给了我，这就代表着魔法的力量快要消失了，我敌人的最后一次机会就是用她那一大群老鼠吓唬你。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: That she did not succeed in doing; so now, my dear Felicia, if you will be married to my son with this silver ring your future happiness is certain.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 她没有成功；所以，现在，我亲爱的费利西娅，如果你愿意戴着这枚银戒指嫁给我儿子，你将来一定会非常幸福的。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Do you think him handsome and amiable enough to be willing to marry him?”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 你觉得他够帅气，够和蔼，让你愿意嫁给他吗？”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “Madam,” replied Felicia, blushing, “you overwhelm me with your kindness.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “夫人，”费利西娅脸红了，回答道，“您的好意让我受宠若惊。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: I know that you are my mother’s sister, and that by your art you turned the soldiers who were sent to kill me into cabbages, and my nurse into a hen, and that you do me only too much honor in proposing that I shall marry your son.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 我知道您是我母亲的姐姐，您用自己的仙术把被派来杀我的士兵变成了卷心菜，把我的乳母变成了母鸡，您建议我嫁给您的儿子，也让我倍感荣幸。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: How can I explain to you the cause of my hesitation?
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 我该怎么向您解释我犹豫的原因呢？

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: I feel, for the first time in my life, how happy it would make me to be beloved.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 我这一生第一次感受到，被人深爱是有多么幸福。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Can you indeed give me the Prince’s heart?”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 您真的能把王子的真心给我吗？”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “It is yours already, lovely Princess!” he cried, taking her hand in his; “but for the horrible enchantment which kept me silent I should have told you long ago how dearly I love you.”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “它已经是你的了，可爱的公主！”他握着她的手，大声说道，“要不是那个可怕的魔咒让我不能说话，我早就想告诉你，我有多爱你。”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: This made the Princess very happy, and the Queen, who could not bear to see her dressed like a poor shepherdess, touched her with her wand, saying:
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 这使公主十分开心，女王不忍心再看到她穿得像个穷牧羊女一般，便用她的魔杖碰了她一下，嘴里说着：

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “I wish you to be attired as befits your rank and beauty.”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “愿你的衣着能与你的地位和美貌相称。”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: And immediately the Princess’s cotton dress became a magnificent robe of silver brocade embroidered with carbuncles, and her soft dark hair was encircled by a crown of diamonds, from which floated a clear white veil.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 公主的棉布裙立刻变为华丽的银线锦缎长袍，上面还装饰着红宝石，她柔软的黑发上戴着钻石王冠，王冠下面飘扬着一袭透明的白色面纱。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: With her bright eyes, and the charming color in her cheeks, she was altogether such a dazzling sight that the Prince could hardly bear it.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 她双眸明亮，面颊色彩迷人，整个人看上去如此太耀眼，王子几乎无法承受。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “How pretty you are, Felicia!” he cried.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “你真美啊，费利西娅！”他惊呼道，

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “Don’t keep me in suspense, I entreat you; say that you will marry me.”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “我恳求你，不要让我的心悬着了；说你会嫁给我。”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “Ah!” said the Queen, smiling, “I think she will not refuse now.”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “啊！”女王微笑着说道，“我想她现在不会拒绝你的。”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Just then Bruno, who was going back to his work, came out of the cottage, and thought he must be dreaming when he saw Felicia; but she called him very kindly, and begged the Queen to take pity on him.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 就在那时，布鲁诺正要回去工作，他从小屋里出来，看到费利西娅的时候，他觉得自己一定是在做梦；但她十分友好地叫了他，请求女王可怜可怜他。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “What!” she said, “when he was so unkind to you?”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “什么！”她说，“可他对你多么无情啊！”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: “Ah! madam,” said the Princess, “I am so happy that I should like everybody else to be happy too.”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: “啊！夫人，”公主说道，“我是如此幸福，以至于也希望所有其他人都能快快乐乐。”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: The Queen kissed her, and said: “Well, to please you, let me see what I can do for this cross Bruno.”
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 女王亲吻了她，并说道：“好，为了使你高兴，我看看我能为这个乖戾的布鲁诺做点儿什么。”

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: And with a wave of her wand she turned the poor little cottage into a splendid palace, full of treasures; only the two stools and the straw bed remained just as they were, to remind him of his former poverty.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 她把魔杖一挥，把破旧的小屋变成一座华丽的宫殿，里面满是金银财宝；只有那两条凳子和稻草床还放在原来的地方，为的是让他不要忘记之前的穷困。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Then the Queen touched Bruno himself, and made him gentle and polite and grateful, and he thanked her and the Princess a thousand times.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 然后女王碰了碰布鲁诺，使他变得温和，礼貌而懂得感恩，他一遍又一遍地感谢着她和公主。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: Lastly, the Queen restored the hen and the cabbages to their natural forms, and left them all very contented.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 最后，女王把母鸡和卷心菜变回了原来的样子，让他们所有人都十分满意。

Felicia and the Pot Of Pinks: The Prince and Princess were married as soon as possible with great splendor, and lived happily ever after.
费利西娅与一盆石竹花: 王子和公主很快举办了一场盛大的婚礼，从此幸福地生活在一起。
